intro: Bobartia purcellii, commonly known as the Purcell's bobartia, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes caraway and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments and is adapted to cold, dry climates. Its botanical features make it a unique subject for ecological and horticultural study. It is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its specific habitat and limited distribution.
